name: amCharts
description: Three libraries for traditional charts, stock, and maps. Features a hand-drawn style theme option.

name: AnyChart
description: Set of products for charting different types of data. Has a special Oracle Apex integration option.

name: CanvasJS
description: A tight set of chart types in a library with a small file size. Different looking default theme than other commercial libraries.

name: FusionCharts
description: Charting library with a strong maps component.

name: Highcharts
description: A series of charting libraries for a variety of uses. Can be compatible back to IE6.

name: ZingChart
description: Built to render large data sets other libraries can't handle. Super customizable styling and new features added often. Everything in one modular library.

name: C3.js
description: D3 based reusable chart library.

name: Chart.js
description: Tiny library (11kb!) including core chart types.

name: Chartist
description: Simple, lightweight chart library that uses SVG to render the chart, and CSS to style it.

name: Chartkick
description: JavaScript charts with one line of Ruby.

name: D3.js
description: Allows the user to manipulate documents based on data to render charts in SVG.

name: dc.js
description: D3 Library with crossfilter support

name: dygraphs
description: Interactive zoomable time series charts.

name: ECharts
description: A powerful charting and visualization library for browser.

name: EJSChart
description: enterprise ready charting library.

name: Graphosaurus
description: 3D graph viewer powered by WebGL (three.js)

name: Morris.js
description: Simple API to render line, bar, area, and donut charts

name: Plotly
description: Built on top of d3 and stack.gl, allowing users to create basic charts and SVG maps.

name: Plottable
description: Library with OOP style syntax to build charts.

name: rgraph
description: 2D/3D javascript charts with google sheets import capabilites.

name: sigma.js
description: Graphs / Network diagram library built with canvas.

name: Smoothie Charts
description: JavaScript charts for realtime streaming data.

name: TauCharts
description: Unique syntax that lets the developer describe the data using DSL. Has the ability to create facets.

name: uvCharts
description: JavaScript Charting library built using d3.js

name: vis.js
description: Network diagrams, descriptive timelines with labels, and has 3D graphs.

name: Google Charts
description: Maps are dialed in (of course) and some cool animation options. Extensive docs and use community (forum).

name: Angular-Chart- Simple API to render line, bar, area, and donut charts
n3-charts
description: Easy to use library written with AngularJS, rendering charts with D3.

name: Angular-scale
description: Simple and lightweight library for creating line charts

name: Ember Charts
description: Five basic chart types ready to go in Ember.js projects.

name: Flot
description: A JavaScript charting library for jQuery. Contains useful chart types but looks like it may no longer be in active development.

name: jqPlot
description: Open source jQuery plugin for drawing charts. Contains many commonly used features but may use different naming conventions for these items.

name: jqxChart
description: Plenty of chart types rendering in SVG, Canvas, and VML.

name: JQuery-linechart
description: Simple and lightweight library for creating line charts

name: Formiddable
description: A collection of composable React components for building interactive data visualizations

name: react-d3
description: Charting library that relies on React for generating SVG markup and d3 to calculate path values.

name: react-vis
description: A collection of React components to render common data visualization charts

name: recharts
description: Redefined chart library built with React and D3

name: Dataviz Catalogue
description: A place to go when you're wondering which chart type is best. A project by Severino Ribecca.

name: Evergreen Data
description: Information and opinions on presenting data more effectively.

name: Flowing Data
description: A resource on maps, visualizations, stats, and design by Nathan Yau, formerly of the New York Times.

name: Junk Charts
description: Dataviz critic (and Columbia professor) Kaiser Fung breaks down data visualizations to identify what is wrong and recommends ways to make them better.

name: The Functional Art
description: Noted data visualization author and professor Aberto Cairo's blog on dataviz trends and best practices.

name: Visualizing Data
description: Dataviz consultant Andy Kirk compiles examples, resources, and reference materials on the subject of charting and visualization.

name: Well Formed Data
description: Thought pieces on information visualization and design by Moritz Stefaner previously of the World Economic Forum.
